concept.title: Connection Monitoring
concept.shortdesc: View live, aggregated connection data, and query the best and worst performing connections across several connection metrics.

section.title: Connection Chart
section.p: Use the connection chart to monitor the current number of active connections to the server, and the rate of new connections.

section.title: Connection Data
section.p: Use the connection data table to view the best or worst performing connections for a particular endpoint and metric. The top 50 connections are displayed.
Predefined queries can be run to view the following metrics:

dlentry.dd: The clients that are connected to the server for the least amount of time.
The clients that are connected to the server for the most amount of time.
Shows the connections that have the lowest throughput that is based on the number of messages that are sent and received.

li.p: Message throughput is a summary of the number of messages that are received and sent over time. For example, if 0 messages are received and 1000 messages are sent across a connection over a period of 1000 seconds, the throughput in terms of messages per second is 1. A connection across which 500 messages are received and 1000 messages are sent over a period of 1500 seconds, also has a throughput of 1.

dlentry.dd: Shows the connections that have the highest throughput that is based on the number of messages that are sent and received.

For example, if 0 messages are received and 1000 messages are sent across a connection over a period of 1000 seconds, the throughput in terms of messages per second is 1. dlentry.dd: Shows the connections that have the lowest throughput that is based on Kilobytes of data that is sent and received.
Shows the connections that have the highest throughput that is based on Kilobytes of data that is sent and received.

section.p: You can monitor only the connections that are based on a specified endpoint. Select a specific endpoint policy, and filter the Connection Data Table output to view connections that use that policy. Use this filter to help you to identify endpoints that are performing poorly.
